Reduce Anxiety (‘Entry Shock’ ) Activity 2

Address Typical Anxieties

Activities can also directly address the anxieties that flexible learners will typically have. Some examples:

Virtual Classroom – Ask students to send a private chat message (to you, the facilitator) about what is making them anxious. Speak to these or paste some of them into the main window/whiteboard so that the new students can see that the fears they have are shared by others. Also address how to deal with those anxieties.

Virtual Learning Environments – Lead a discussion, using the discussion forum, to address typical anxieties and give a space for students to ask questions relating to the programme, how to study etc. Also address how to deal with those anxieties.
